description: Wunderlist is the easiest way to get stuff done. Whether you’re planning a holiday, sharing a shopping list with a partner or managing multiple work projects, Wunderlist is here to help you tick off all your personal and professional to-dos.
steps: Create WunderList application in console https://developer.wunderlist.com/apps/new
After creating app, you will receive clienId and clientSecret.

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Exchange code for an access token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: client_secret
args.info: The client secret you received from Wunderlist when you registered.

args.name: code
args.info: The code you received as a auth response, see more in readme.

blocks.name: getAllFolders
blocks.description: Get all Folders created by the the current User.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

blocks.name: getFolder
blocks.description: Get a specific Folder.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: folderId
args.info: Single folder id which will be returned.

blocks.name: createFolder
blocks.description: Create a Folder.The created Folder is automatically owned by the User who creates it. Only the owner of a Folder can actually see/request it.See more in readme.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: title
args.info: Folder title (maximum length is 255 characters).

args.name: listIds
args.info: list of ids.

structure.name: listId
structure.info: Single list id which be added to the folder.

blocks.name: updateFolder
blocks.description: Update a Folder by overwriting properties.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: revision
args.info: Every entity in the Wunderlist API has a read-only revision property. This property is an integer which is updated in response to changes to that entity or any of its children. See more in readme.

args.name: folderId
args.info: Single folder id.

args.name: title
args.info: Folder title (maximum length is 255 characters).

args.name: listIds
args.info: list of ids.

structure.name: listId
structure.info: Single list id which be added to the folder.

blocks.name: deleteFolder
blocks.description: Delete a Folder permanently.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: revision
args.info: Every entity in the Wunderlist API has a read-only revision property. This property is an integer which is updated in response to changes to that entity or any of its children. See more in readme.

args.name: folderId
args.info: Single folder id which will be deleted.

blocks.name: getFolderRevisions
blocks.description: Every entity in the Wunderlist API has a read-only revision property. This property is an integer which is updated in response to changes to that entity or any of its children. When the title of a task is changed, that task’s revision is updated—as well as the revisions of all of the parent items of that task, including list and root entities.See more in readme.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

blocks.name: GetSpecificTask

args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: listId
args.info: Single list id.

args.name: title
args.info: Task title (maximum length is 255 characters).

args.name: assigneeId
args.info: Single assignee id.

args.name: completed
args.info: If set `true` - Get Completed Subtasks.If set `false` - Get uncompleted Subtasks.

args.name: recurrenceType
args.info: Must be accompanied by recurrenceCount.

args.name: recurrenceCount
args.info: must be >= 1, must be accompanied by recurrenceType.

args.name: dueDate
args.info: Task date.

blocks.name: updateTask
blocks.description: Update a task by overwriting properties.Tasks are children of lists.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: taskId
args.info: Task id which will be updated.

args.name: listId
args.info: Can be given to move the Task into a different List.

args.name: title
args.info: Task title (maximum length is 255 characters).

args.name: revision
args.info: Every entity in the Wunderlist API has a read-only revision property. This property is an integer which is updated in response to changes to that entity or any of its children. See more in readme.

args.info: Single assignee id.

args.name: completed
args.info: If set `true` - Get Completed Subtasks.If set `false` - Get uncompleted Subtasks.

args.name: recurrenceType
args.info: Must be accompanied by recurrenceCount.

args.name: recurrenceCount
args.info: must be >= 1, must be accompanied by recurrenceType.

args.name: dueDate
args.info: Task date.

args.name: remove
args.info: An list of attributes to delete from the task, e.g. 'dueDate'

blocks.name: deleteTask
blocks.description: Delete a task.Tasks are children of lists.

args.info: Every entity in the Wunderlist API has a read-only revision property. This property is an integer which is updated in response to changes to that entity or any of its children. See more in readme.

blocks.name: getAllWebhooks

args.info: Restricts the list of returned webhooks.

blocks.name: createWebhook
blocks.description: Create a Webhook.A webhook sends notifications when a list is updated.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: listId
args.info: Restricts the list of returned webhooks.

args.name: webhookUrl
args.info: Callback url for webhook.Maximum length is 255 characters.

args.name: processorType
args.info: can be ''.

args.name: configuration
args.info: Example. - generic.

blocks.name: deleteWebhook
blocks.description: Delete a Webhook.A webhook sends notifications when a list is updated.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: webhookId
args.info: Webhook id which will be deleted.

args.name: revision
args.info: Every entity in the Wunderlist API has a read-only revision property. This property is an integer which is updated in response to changes to that entity or any of its children. See more in readme.

blocks.name: getFilesForTask
blocks.description: Get Files for a Task.The first resource that needs to be created to upload a file is the Upload resource. After the upload is finished you need to create a new File resource that will published via real time to all the other members of the List you are creating the File in.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: taskId
args.info: Single task id.

blocks.name: getFilesForList
blocks.description: Get Files for a Task.The first resource that needs to be created to upload a file is the Upload resource. After the upload is finished you need to create a new File resource that will published via real time to all the other members of the List you are creating the File in.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: listId
args.info: Single list id.

blocks.name: getSpecificFile
blocks.description: Get a specific File.The first resource that needs to be created to upload a file is the Upload resource. After the upload is finished you need to create a new File resource that will published via real time to all the other members of the List you are creating the File in.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: fileId
args.info: File id which will be returned.

blocks.name: createFile
blocks.description: Create a File.The first resource that needs to be created to upload a file is the Upload resource. After the upload is finished you need to create a new File resource that will published via real time to all the other members of the List you are creating the File in.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: uploadId
args.info: Upload id which will be attached.

args.name: taskId
args.info: Single task id.

args.name: localCreatedAt
args.info: For creating files we have introduced the :localCreatedAt from comments again. This attribute will help us later to sort the files and comments in the right order.

blocks.name: deleteFile
blocks.description: Destroy a File.The first resource that needs to be created to upload a file is the Upload resource. After the upload is finished you need to create a new File resource that will published via real time to all the other members of the List you are creating the File in.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: fileId
args.info: File id which will be returned.

args.name: revision
args.info: Every entity in the Wunderlist API has a read-only revision property. This property is an integer which is updated in response to changes to that entity or any of its children. See more in readme.

blocks.name: getPreviewOfFile
blocks.description: A file preview is an image thumbnail for a file.The preview endpoint will generate a preview image on-demand for the given file. This endpoint only works with images for now.See more in readme.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: fileId
args.info: File id which will be returned.

args.name: platform
args.info: Platform for preview.

args.name: size
args.info: Size for preview.

blocks.name: createUpload
blocks.description: The first resource that needs to be created to upload a file is the Upload resource. After the upload is finished you need to create a new File resource that will published via real time to all the other members of the List you are creating the File in.See more in readme.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: fileSize
args.info: File size.

args.name: contentType
args.info: Content type of file.

args.name: fileName
args.info: File name.

args.name: partNumber
args.info: The partNumber attribute always starts with 1, never with 0. The expiresAt date represents the lifetime of the given part.

args.name: md5sum
args.info: Md5 hash.

blocks.name: uploadFileOnAmazon
blocks.description: After call createUpload endpoints , the needed information and credentials to upload your first part to the given Amazon URL.See more in readme.

args.name: uploadFile
args.info: Upload file.

args.name: uploadUrl
args.info: Upload url field from createUpload endpoints.

args.name: uploadDate
args.info: With the `date` string of the part from createUpload endpoints.

args.name: uploadAuthorization
args.info: With the `authorization` string of the part. from createUpload endpoints.

blocks.name: getUploadParts
blocks.description: Fetching new parts for the chunked upload.If you need more than one part to upload the new file you need to call the following endpoint to get another one.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The Client ID you received from Wunderlist when you registered your application.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth token for the current user.

args.name: uploadId
args.info: Upload id which will be returned.

args.name: partNumber
args.info: The partNumber attribute always starts with 1, never with 0. The expiresAt date represents the lifetime of the given part.

args.name: md5sum
args.info: Md5 hash.
